content:
• Tuesday, November 15, 2011
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A) FQ4 EPS beats estimates, but revenue comes in slightly below...

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A) FQ4 EPS beats estimates, but revenue comes in slightly below estimates. Profit dipped slightly as aquisition charges and write downs weighed on bottom-line results. Additionally, the company now expects its Q1 EPS to come in below estimates. It now sees an EPS of $0.67 - $0.69 per share, slightly below Street expectations for $0.70. Shares -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • CNQR

    Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR) drops 4.8% AH after posting its FQ4 report. Revenue of of...

    Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR) drops 4.8% AH after posting its FQ4 report. Revenue of of $95.2M (+23% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.37 beat by $0.5M and $0.13, and the company is guiding for FQ1 2012 revenue growth of 23% (21.5% consensus) and EPS of $0.29 ($0.23 consensus). However, with a trailing P/E of 51 as of today's close, the market seems underwhelmed with the top-line figures.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • OZM

    Money manager Och-Ziff Capital (NYSE:OZM) drops 7.3% AH after announcing it will sell $250M...

    Money manager Och-Ziff Capital (NYSE:OZM) drops 7.3% AH after announcing it will sell $250M worth of Class A shares, and that it's entered into a $391M term loan arranged by Goldman Sachs. The company plans to use some of the proceeds from the stock offering to repurchase debt owed by an affiliate, at 95% of par value.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • ZOOM

    Chinese mobile phone manufacturer Zoom Technologies (NASDAQ:ZOOM) plunges after cutting FY11...

    Chinese mobile phone manufacturer Zoom Technologies (NASDAQ:ZOOM) plunges after cutting FY11 sales guidance to $250-$255M against expectations of $331M. The company sees FY12 sales of $360-$380M vs. $404M consensus. Shares -23% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • BOBE

    Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE) FQ2 comes in light of estimates despite efforts to prop up per...

    Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE) FQ2 comes in light of estimates despite efforts to prop up per share results through an accelerated buyback. Bottom line margins were impacted by a significant increase in pork prices, plus higher marketing costs to promote seasonal sales programs. The company reaffirms FY12 EPS guidance of $2.36 to $2.44 and annual earnings growth guidance of approximately 7% to 10% over the next five years. Shares -2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • VELTF

    Mobile ad services provider Velti (VELT) gains 8% AH after posting Q3 results and announcing the...

    Mobile ad services provider Velti (VELT) gains 8% AH after posting Q3 results and announcing the acquisition of British rival Mobile Interactive Group. While Q3 results were mixed - revenue of $38.2M (+85% Y/Y) beat by $2.7M, but EPS of -$0.02 missed by $0.02 - the company is guiding for organic 2011 revenue (excludes acquisitions) of $176M-$180M, above a prior range of $172M-$177M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • IDIX

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) fall 5.9% AH after the firm announces plans for a...

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) fall 5.9% AH after the firm announces plans for a public offering of an undisclosed amount of common stock to be underwritten by JPMorgan.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • ASYS

    Shares of Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS) are getting hit hard in the post-session after its FQ4...

    Shares of Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS) are getting hit hard in the post-session after its FQ4 beats estimates, but the company lowers guidance for FQ1. The company says current supply/demand imbalances and deteriorating global economic conditions are causing solar cell manufacturers to significantly slow or push out capacity expansion plans. Shares -19% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    More on Dell's (DELL-OLD) FQ3: Sales hurt by 6% drop in consumer revenue (1% growth in FQ2), and...

    More on Dell's (DELL-OLD) FQ3: Sales hurt by 6% drop in consumer revenue (1% growth in FQ2), and 2% drop in government revenue. Bolstered by 4% growth in sales to large enterprises (1% in FQ2). Server and networking revenue +13% Y/Y, and services revenue +10%. However, desktop PC sales were down 6%, and notebook sales down 2%. $600M in shares repurchased. Dell -1.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • LDR

    Medical services outsourcing firm Landauer (LDR +3.5%) closes near its high for the day after...

    Medical services outsourcing firm Landauer (LDR +3.5%) closes near its high for the day after saying late yesterday it acquired all of the remaining outstanding equity interests of IZI Medical Products for around $93M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • KEX

    Kirby (KEX +3%) holds on to gains late in the session after being initiated with a Buy at...

    Kirby (KEX +3%) holds on to gains late in the session after being initiated with a Buy at Dahlman Rose with a price target of $16.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • CS

    Rochdale's Dick Bove cuts his rating on Credit Suisse (CS -3%) to Neutral and his price target...

    Rochdale's Dick Bove cuts his rating on Credit Suisse (CS -3%) to Neutral and his price target to $28 from $34, citing the ongoing fight with the IRS in handing over client names suspected of evading U.S. taxes, a potential ratings downgrade, and the need to build capital to meet Basel III requirements. The latter "is a big one," Bove says, as it will constrict the bank's ability to grow.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • HW

    Building products manufacturer Headwaters (HW +19.8%) jumps after it says it repurchased and...

    Building products manufacturer Headwaters (HW +19.8%) jumps after it says it repurchased and canceled $6.5M in face value of 2.5% convertible notes due in 2014, totaling approximately $4.7M. Separately, Wedbush also upgrades the shares to Outperform based valuation and improving overall metrics.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • BHC

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG -10.5%) takes a hit after raising FQ1 guidance - now saying it expects...

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG -10.5%) takes a hit after raising FQ1 guidance - now saying it expects revenues to be in the range of $13.3M to $13.6M - but still coming in below Street expectations for $14.17M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +3.4%), hammered this month after disclosing accounting irregularities in...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +3.4%), hammered this month after disclosing accounting irregularities in its payments to walnut farmers (I, II, III), rallies off its 52-week low after Jefferies comes to its defense, claiming alleged motives for Diamond's misrepresentation of the payments don't make sense. Nonetheless, Jefferies is critical of management's handling of the issue.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • CVX

    Chevron (CVX -3%) shares remain under pressure after a report that an oil spill off Brazil...

    Chevron (CVX -3%) shares remain under pressure after a report that an oil spill off Brazil "could be 10 times bigger" than official estimates. Other stocks affected: Transocean (RIG -4.9%), which reportedly operated the CVX well; Petrobras (PBR +0.4%), which owns a 30% stake in the well; Clean Harbors (CLH +2.2%), which offers environmental cleanup services on customer sites.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • PRSN

    BSD Medical (BSDM +3%) is trading higher today on the announcement that the Cancer Treatment...

    BSD Medical (BSDM +3%) is trading higher today on the announcement that the Cancer Treatment Centers of America is purchasing a new unit of its BSD-500 Hyperthermia System. This makes the sixth BSD-500 system that the Cancer Treatment Centers have purchased.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +17.6%) takes off after Jim Cramer hosts CEO Andrew Littlefair on...

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +17.6%) takes off after Jim Cramer hosts CEO Andrew Littlefair on Monday evening's broadcast of Mad Money. Cramer mentioned during the broadcast that he's a fan of the company, which provides natural gas for transportation fleets. Update: Shares also appear to be getting a boost from the introduction of a bill to provide increased support for natural gas-fueled vehicles.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • USO

    It's another multi-month high for WTI crude, which nudges up to $100/barrel before pulling back...

    It's another multi-month high for WTI crude, which nudges up to $100/barrel before pulling back a hair to $99.46. Just another risk asset tightly correlated to the S&P for most of the year, crude has shot higher in the past month as stocks push just a bit over the flatline. USO +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • VIT

    Shares of VanceInfo Technologies (VIT +22%) bounce back hard from early morning losses after its...

    Shares of VanceInfo Technologies (VIT +22%) bounce back hard from early morning losses after its Q3 results largely disappointed. Profit fell 59% Y/Y, as the Chinese outsourcing company saw rising input costs continue to outweigh strong sales growth. However, the stock has already been hammered, down 73% over the past year, and investors appear to be finding encouragement in the company's raising of its FY revenue growth estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • RSH

    Radio Shack (RSH -2.3%) trades lower after S&P cuts its debt rating to BB- from BB, three...

    Radio Shack (RSH -2.3%) trades lower after S&P cuts its debt rating to BB- from BB, three notches below investment-grade. The ratings agency expects Radio Shack's poor operating performance, manifested in a weak Q3 report, will continue into 2012, given weak macro conditions and strong competition for Radio Shack's wireless business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • CVX

    Shares of Chevron (NYSE:CVX) trail off - now down 3% after being in positive territory most of...

    Shares of Chevron (NYSE:CVX) trail off - now down 3% after being in positive territory most of they day - on increased chatter that an oil spill in Brazil may be larger than first reported.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTOR

    Meritor (MTOR -16.5%) gets hammered after its FQ4 EPS beat estimates, but revenue came up short...

    Meritor (MTOR -16.5%) gets hammered after its FQ4 EPS beat estimates, but revenue came up short due to higher input costs. Earnings actally soared 39% Y/Y on double-digit sales growth in all the auto part maker's segments, but bottom line margins were hit hard by ongoing expenses related to its restructuring.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • VIVHY

    Videogame stocks slide after Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) sells 35M shares of Activision Blizzard...

    Videogame stocks slide after Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) sells 35M shares of Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI), reducing its stake by about three percentage points to 60%. The 35M shares represent nearly four days of average trading volume in the stock; pressured by the increased supply, ATVI -4.3%, to $12.25. Also: THQI -7.6%, GME -2.8%, TTWO -1.2%, ERTS -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) is now up 13.7% on the day after it's disclosed CEO Paul Bulmahn bought...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) is now up 13.7% on the day after it's disclosed CEO Paul Bulmahn bought 35K shares today at a price of $5.85. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • OKE

    ONEOK (OKE +1.4%) trades higher on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight, citing the company's...

    ONEOK (OKE +1.4%) trades higher on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight, citing the company's volume growth from its Bakken and Mid-Continent reserves, plus its effort to redisribute capital to shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +10.5%) remains volatile in the wake of last week's post-earnings...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +10.5%) remains volatile in the wake of last week's post-earnings crash, rallying sharply today after selling off yesterday, even as it's reported major hedge funds pared their stakes in the company. With 23.2% of Green Mountain's float shorted as of Oct. 31, and many of those shorts now sitting on big profits, more volatility could be on the way.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • SPLS

    Staples (SPLS -4.2%) is having a bad day after missing FQ3 revenue forecasts and providing tepid...

    Staples (SPLS -4.2%) is having a bad day after missing FQ3 revenue forecasts and providing tepid FQ4 sales guidance. A 12% decline in European same-store sales is likely also raising eyebrows. Oppenheimer is maintaining a neutral stance; the firm is worried about U.S. and European macro troubles, but is impressed with Staples' expense controls and strong cash flow. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • AVT

    Avnet (AVT +2.5%) gains after announcing it's signed a distribution agreement with electronics...

    Avnet (AVT +2.5%) gains after announcing it's signed a distribution agreement with electronics component maker Xi3 to sell and distribute the Xi3 Modular Computer along with other products and technologies to customers like solution providers, systems integrators, resellers and value-added resellers in the Americas.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • MDT

    Covidien (COV +2.4%) gains after its FQ4 EPS easily beat estimates. Earnings rose 1.8% Y/Y,...

    Covidien (COV +2.4%) gains after its FQ4 EPS easily beat estimates. Earnings rose 1.8% Y/Y, fueled by growth in its medical-devices business and an extra week of sales that boosted revenue by 7% - 8% during the period. The company also boosts FY12 sales guidance to an increase of around 3% - 5% due to positive FX rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • VLTC

    Mobile advertising and Web portal provider Motricity (MOTR -9.9%), which received a loan from...

    Mobile advertising and Web portal provider Motricity (MOTR -9.9%), which received a loan from Carl Icahn in September, continues its 2011 freefall after reporting Q3 results. Revenue of $30.4M (-20% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.31 missed consensus by $1.4M and $0.22... and that's excluding $162.3M in impairment charges. Motricity shares are down 92% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • AM-OLD

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +1.5%) gains after announcing plans to sell $225M of senior notes in...

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +1.5%) gains after announcing plans to sell $225M of senior notes in a secondary offering. The company intends to use the proceeds to fund a cash tender offer for about $255M of higher interest debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences (CSC +6.3%) soars on a WSJ report of PE interest - including from firms such...

    Computer Sciences (CSC +6.3%) soars on a WSJ report of PE interest - including from firms such as Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and TPG Capital. The IT services provider has long thought to be coveted by buyout firms, and recent share declines may make the company a compelling value.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDT

    Given Imaging (GIVN +1.2%) gets a boost after announcing the initiation of trials in Japan using...

    Given Imaging (GIVN +1.2%) gets a boost after announcing the initiation of trials in Japan using its colorectal imaging technology, PillCam Colon 2. The study part of the company's plan to eventually submit the technology for approval with Japan's Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • BONT

    Shares of Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -3.8%) slip after announcing CEO Bud Bergren plans to leave...

    Shares of Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -3.8%) slip after announcing CEO Bud Bergren plans to leave his current role and transition to Chairman once the company hires a successor. The move comes just days after the company sharply lowered its bottom-line guidance for the year and posted weak October same-store sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • ATPAQ

    Shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +7.4%) bounce back after shedding some 45% in recent days on...

    Shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +7.4%) bounce back after shedding some 45% in recent days on worries about the company’s ability to pay its bills next year, but Jefferies says ATP’s not out of the woods. ATP will "need additional external financing... but sources are difficult to identify," and its wells are "underperforming, putting further strain on an already precarious liquidity position."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • HRB

    H&R Block (HRB +1%) moves up on renewed speculation of a takeover.

    H&R Block (HRB +1%) moves up on renewed speculation of a takeover.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • PVR

    Shares of Penn Virginia Resource Partners (PVR -6.8%) trade lower after the company prices its...

    Shares of Penn Virginia Resource Partners (PVR -6.8%) trade lower after the company prices its 7M share offering at $24.55, a 4.1% discount to Monday's closing price. The company plans to use the proceeds to repay some of its debt outstanding under its revolving credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • BK

    Bank of New York (BK -1.6%) dives as JPMorgan downgrades the stock from Overweight to Neutral.

    Bank of New York (BK -1.6%) dives as JPMorgan downgrades the stock from Overweight to Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • HSTM

    Online health solutions provider HealthStream (HSTM -8.3%) trades lower after the company...

    Online health solutions provider HealthStream (HSTM -8.3%) trades lower after the company announced a 3.25M share secondary offering late yesterday. William Blair will be sole book running manager of the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • BRK.A

    Several names are outperforming today after Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.A, BRK.B) latest 13-F...

    Several names are outperforming today after Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.A, BRK.B) latest 13-F disclosed  Warren Buffett's company had bought shares in them (I, II). INTC +1.4%. CVS +0.5%. V +0.8%. DTV +1.2%. DG +1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AAL

    AMR (AMR -7%) shares tumble after the American Airlines parent tries to end its labor stalemate...

    AMR (AMR -7%) shares tumble after the American Airlines parent tries to end its labor stalemate with a contract proposal that offers pilots smaller pay increases than they had sought in bridging a "wide gulf" between the two sides. AMRis urging a rank-and-file vote on the first full contract proposal in more than five years of talks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +1.4%) took off once again on takeover rumors, but has since given back some of its...

    Cree (CREE +1.4%) took off once again on takeover rumors, but has since given back some of its gains; it's been speculated for years that lighting giants GE and Philips (NYSE:PHG) might be interested in making a bid. As always, the company says it won't comment on rumors. (October)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • MNK

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX -4.5%) trades down after pricing its 19M share offering at $3.75...

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX -4.5%) trades down after pricing its 19M share offering at $3.75 per share, a 5.5% discount to Monday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • WMT

    Having closed on Monday near its 52-week high, Wal-Mart (WMT -2.7%) is selling off today after...

    Having closed on Monday near its 52-week high, Wal-Mart (WMT -2.7%) is selling off today after delivering a mixed FQ3 report. However, BofA (Buy) likes what it sees, noting U.S. same-store sales growth was positive for the first time in roughly 10 quarters, and customer traffic trends are improving.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • CEL

    Cellcom Israel (CEL -2.44%) dips after its Q3 earnings fall 40% Y/Y, as the Israeli cellular...

    Cellcom Israel (CEL -2.44%) dips after its Q3 earnings fall 40% Y/Y, as the Israeli cellular provider continues to see a decline in service revenue and a rising churn rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG -12.1%) fall apart on heavy trading linked to profit-taking after the...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG -12.1%) fall apart on heavy trading linked to profit-taking after the company beat estimates for Q3 EPS and revenue. Revised guidance from Zagg on full-year revenue came in at $170M - on the high-end of its prior estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +5.2%), up yesterday on Steve Wozniak's CNBC appearance, catches a bid today...

    Fusion-io (FIO +5.2%), up yesterday on Steve Wozniak's CNBC appearance, catches a bid today after introducing a 10TB version of its high-end ioDrive Octal flash memory module, doubling the capacity of the current Octal product. Co-founder Rick White thinks the new version will allow Fusion-io to enter the fast-growing data warehousing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM

  • Shares of chinese chemical producer Gulf Resources (GURE -15.6%%) tank after its Q3 results...

    Shares of chinese chemical producer Gulf Resources (GURE -15.6%%) tank after its Q3 results disappoint across the board. Revenue dipped 16% Y/Y on a 56% drop in in operating income, as a tighter credit environment in China led to a reduction of orders from some key clients and lower overall sales volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • PEP

    PepsiCo (PEP +2.6%) is sharply higher following word last night that Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund...

    PepsiCo (PEP +2.6%) is sharply higher following word last night that Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund has taken a 2.3M share stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +2.1%) outperforms after RBC's Mark Sue upgrades shares to Buy and lifts his 2012...

    Riverbed (RVBD +2.1%) outperforms after RBC's Mark Sue upgrades shares to Buy and lifts his 2012 estimates. Sue is bullish on account of an improving order pipeline, stabilizing European sales, and a belief Riverbed could win a bigger share of deals in the WAN optimization hardware market, where it has a dominant position, as rivals de-emphasize their offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • BZH

    Beazer Homes (BZH -2.9%) trades lower as top-line numbers beat FQ4 expectations on higher...

    Beazer Homes (BZH -2.9%) trades lower as top-line numbers beat FQ4 expectations on higher closings Y/Y, but operating EPS and core gross margins came in below Street estimates. Analysts are viewing Y/Y revenue gains in homebuilders with a sceptical eye, as results are skewed from slumping sales last summer following the expiration of the federal home buyer tax credit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • CFX

    Colfax (CFX +4.2%) trades higher after UBS upgrades its rating to Buy from Neutral. Shares now...

    Colfax (CFX +4.2%) trades higher after UBS upgrades its rating to Buy from Neutral. Shares now trade just a hair under their 52-week high after running up 33% over the last month as the company continues to meet with lenders to line up financing for its acquisition of Charter International (OTC:CHITF).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • P

    A day after dropping 7.4%, Pandora (P -1.7%) shares are underperforming again. Yesterday's move...

    A day after dropping 7.4%, Pandora (P -1.7%) shares are underperforming again. Yesterday's move appears to have been due to the belated arrival of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) iTunes Match service; today's move could be due to Nokia's (NYSE:NOK) introduction of a Pandora-like streaming service for its Lumia phones.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • GERN

    Geron (GERN -21%) adds to yesterday's AH decline following its announcement that it was...

    Geron (GERN -21%) adds to yesterday's AH decline following its announcement that it was discontinuing the further development of its stem-cell programs and will eliminate 38% of its work force. The biopharmaceutical company plans to restructure its business to focus its resources on advancing its two cancer-drug candidates.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • AL

    Air Lease (NYSE:AL) falls 6.8% after pushing forward a plan to offer $300M of convertible senior...

    Air Lease (NYSE:AL) falls 6.8% after pushing forward a plan to offer $300M of convertible senior notes. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund the acquisition of commercial aircraft and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • LRN

    Shares of K12 (LRN -12.2%) drop sharply even after the firm doubled its FQ1 profit while...

    Shares of K12 (LRN -12.2%) drop sharply even after the firm doubled its FQ1 profit while boosting revenue 43% Y/Y. Investors may stand unimpressed with the firm's FY12 revenue guidance of $680M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • JEC

    Technical services contractor Jacobs Engineering (JEC +3.9%) trades higher after reporting FQ4...

    Technical services contractor Jacobs Engineering (JEC +3.9%) trades higher after reporting FQ4 revenue of $2.72B (+16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.74; the former missed by $50M, but the latter beat by a penny. The company's backlog grew by $300M Q/Q, and $1.1B Y/Y, to $14.3B. Jacobs is establishing FY12 EPS guidance of $2.80-$3.20, which compares with a $2.98B consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • STX

    The disk-drive sector is hit by a pair of analyst downgrades: Deutsche Bank cuts Seagate (STX...

    The disk-drive sector is hit by a pair of analyst downgrades: Deutsche Bank cuts Seagate (STX -2.8%) to Hold, after the stock rose 50% in the last three months; and Needham cuts Western Digital (WDC -3.1%) to Hold, on concerns the company's pending acquisition of Hitachi’s disk-drive business - if it goes through - could involve concessions that limit the benefits of the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) agrees to acquire assets in North Dakota's Williston Basin for...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) agrees to acquire assets in North Dakota's Williston Basin for $590M in cash and stock, but shares -3.1% premarket as the company also says it will offer 37.5M common shares and significantly increase its capital expenditures next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) -2.4% premarket after Needham downgrades shares to Hold from Strong...

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) -2.4% premarket after Needham downgrades shares to Hold from Strong Buy, saying while OVTI significantly lowered its FQ2 revenue outlook, the image sensor company also faces two long-term challenges: gross margin compression due to increasing pricing pressure; and accelerating competition in the 8MP non-Apple smartphone market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CIM

    Premarket gainers: CIM +7%. MX +7%. DKS +6%. RVBD +3%.Losers: GERN -20%. HAFC -15%. LDK -8%....

    Premarket gainers: CIM +7%. MX +7%. DKS +6%. RVBD +3%.
    Losers: GERN -20%. HAFC -15%. LDK -8%. CADX -8%. PVR -6%. NBG -5%. FRO -5%. ING -5%. ATVI -5%. URBN -4%. KOG -4%. CS -4%. TTWO -4%. LOGI -3%. MT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • CIM

    Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) gets a boost when Jefferies reiterates a Hold rating and $3 PT...

    Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) gets a boost when Jefferies reiterates a Hold rating and $3 PT after closely watching developments over the firm's late 10Q filing.
